org.waarp.common.utility

Class UUID

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.waarp.common.utility.UUID
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<UUID>

    public final class UUID
extends Object
implements Comparable<UUID>
    UUID Generator (also Global UUID Generator)

    Inspired from com.groupon locality-uuid which used combination of internal counter value - process id - fragment of MAC address and Timestamp. see https://github.com/groupon/locality-uuid.java

    But force sequence and take care of errors and improves some performance issues
    Author:
    "Frederic Bregier"

      • UUID

      • UUID

        public UUID(int id)
        Constructor that generates a new UUID using the current process id, MAC address, and timestamp
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the subset of UUID from which it belongs to (default being 0, else between 1 and 255)

      • UUID

        public UUID(boolean on128bits)
        Create a UUID immediately compatible with a standard UUID implementation
        Parameters:
        on128bits - True for 128 bits limitation (16 Bytes instead of 20 Bytes)

    • Method Detail

      • setMAC

        public static void setMAC(byte[] mac)
        Up to the 6 first bytes will be used. If Null or less than 6 bytes, extra bytes will be randomly generated.
        Parameters:
        mac - the MAC address in byte format (up to the 6 first bytes will be used)

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        copy the uuid of this UUID, so that it can't be changed, and return it
        Returns:
        raw byte array of UUID

      • getVersion

        public final int getVersion()
        extract version field as a hex char from raw UUID bytes
        Returns:
        version char

      • getId

        public final int getId()
        Returns:
        the id of the subset of UUID from which it belongs to (default being 0)

      • getProcessId

        public final int getProcessId()
        extract process id from raw UUID bytes and return as int
        Returns:
        id of process that generated the UUID, or -1 for unrecognized format

      • getCounter

        public final int getCounter()
        Returns:
        the associated counter value

      • getTimestamp

        public final long getTimestamp()
        extract timestamp from raw UUID bytes and return as int
        Returns:
        millisecond UTC timestamp from generation of the UUID, or -1 for unrecognized format

      • getMacFragment

        public final byte[] getMacFragment()
        extract MAC address fragment from raw UUID bytes, setting missing values to 0, from the active MAC address when the UUID was generated
        Returns:
        byte array of UUID fragment, or null for unrecognized format

      • getLeastSignificantBits

        public long getLeastSignificantBits()
        Returns:
        the least significant bits (as in standard UUID implementation)

      • getMostSignificantBits

        public long getMostSignificantBits()
        Returns:
        the most significant bits (as in standard UUID implementation)

      • getJavaUuid

        public UUID getJavaUuid()
        Returns:
        a UUID compatible with Java.Util package implementation

        public byte[] javaUuidGetBytes()
        copy the uuid of this UUID, so that it can't be changed, and return it
        Returns:
        raw byte array of UUID for a 16 Bytes UUID

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Simply return a new UUID. If an argument is provided, 2 cases occur:
        - length <= 3 = same as UUID(int) - length > 3 = same as checking the given UUID in String format
        Parameters:
        args -
